events.name: connected
events.summary: Fired when the connection through the socket is established.

properties.name: socket
properties.summary: The socket through which the connection was made.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: disconnected
events.summary: Fired when connection to the socket is lost.

properties.name: socket
properties.summary: The socket on which the data was received.

properties.name: message
properties.summary: The localized message of the exception that accompanies the disconnect event. The localized message is Socket is Disconnected.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: socket
properties.summary: The socket that encounter the error.

properties.name: errorMessage
properties.summary: The error message for the error encountered on the socket. The error can be encountered while performing any socket operations like- socket connecting to remote device, cancelling the connecting operation, closing the socket, socket connection gets lost etc. Note:- If the error message "Device connection was lost." comes, that signifies the connection with the socket is lost which can occur if the device goes out of bluetooth range, remote device deliberately disconnects the connection, etc.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: receivedData
events.summary: Fired when data is received on this socket.

properties.name: socket
properties.summary: The socket on which the data was received.

properties.name: data
properties.summary: A buffer object holding the data received.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

methods.name: cancelConnect
methods.summary: Drops the ongoing connection attempt if in progress.
methods.description: If there is no connection attempt in progress, it does nothing.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Listen for the disconnected event to be notified when socket is closed or the error in case of failure.

methods.name: connect
methods.summary: Starts the connection to the remote device.
methods.description: This call will block until a connection is established or the connection fails. Listen for the connected event to be notified when the connection is established.

methods.name: getReadBufferSize
methods.summary: Get the size of the read buffer in bytes.

returns.summary: Size of the read buffer in bytes.

methods.name: getRemoteDevice
methods.summary: Get the remote device this socket is associated with.

returns.summary: The object representing the device to which this socket is connected to.

methods.name: isConnected
methods.summary: Determines whether there is an active connection with the remote device.

methods.name: isConnecting
methods.summary: Determines whether there is an ongoing connection attempt in progress.

returns.summary: True if connection attempt in progress false otherwise

methods.name: setReadBufferSize
methods.summary: Sets the size of the read buffer in bytes.
methods.description: You can set the read buffer size at any time, but it will only take effect during the next connection. By default, the buffer size is 4*1024 bytes.

parameters.name: newReadBufferSize
parameters.summary: The desired size of the read buffer in bytes.

methods.name: write
methods.summary: Sends an array of bytes over the socket.
methods.description: If the socket is not connected, then this method will throw an error.

parameters.name: buffer
parameters.summary: Represents the data to be sent over the socket.

properties.name: readBufferSize
properties.summary: The size of the read buffer in bytes. By default, the buffer size is 4*1024 bytes.
